q: How do I create an account?
a: Go to Register, choose your role (Customer or Service Provider), and complete the form.

q: Can I sign in with Google?
a: Yes, use ‘Continue with Google’ on the Login page.

q: I forgot my password. What should I do?
a: Use ‘Forgot password’ on the Login page to receive reset instructions by email.

q: How do I change my email or name?
a: Open your profile from the top-right menu and update details there.

q: What is the difference between Customer, Service Provider, Third Party, and Admin?
a: Customers plan and book services, Providers offer services, Third Party vendors handle specialized orders, and Admins manage the platform.

q: I logged in but don’t see my dashboard.
a: Your role determines the dashboard. Log out and sign in with the correct account, or contact support to update your role.

q: What event types do you support?
a: Common categories include weddings, corporate events, parties, and custom events. Browse Events for details.

q: When should I start planning my event?
a: We recommend starting 6–12 weeks ahead; for larger or custom events, plan 3–4 months ahead.

q: Can I create an event without booking providers yet?
a: Yes. Create your event first, then add services at any time.

q: How do I find service providers?
a: Go to Services or Providers by category. Filter by location, budget, ratings, and availability.

q: What’s shown on a provider profile?
a: Overview, services, pricing, portfolio, reviews, FAQs, and policies so you can compare options.

q: How do I contact a provider?
a: Use the ‘Message’ or ‘Request Quote’ button on the provider profile.

q: How do bookings work?
a: Request a quote from a provider. Once accepted, confirm the booking and follow payment instructions in your dashboard.

q: Can I edit a booking after confirmation?
a: Minor changes may be allowed depending on the provider’s policy. Use the booking page or message the provider.

q: Where do I pay for bookings?
a: Open the booking’s Payments section in your dashboard to see payment options and status.

q: Do you offer refunds?
a: Refunds are defined by each provider’s cancellation policy. Check the policy on the provider profile and during checkout.

q: How do I cancel a booking?
a: Open the booking and select Cancel. Review the provider’s cancellation policy before confirming.

q: Can I reschedule my booking?
a: Yes, if the provider has availability. Use the booking’s change request or message the provider.

q: When can I leave a review?
a: After your event is completed. Open the completed booking and choose ‘Leave a review’.

q: Can I upload photos with my review?
a: Yes, attach images when submitting your review from the booking page.

q: Where are my messages?
a: In the Messages section of your dashboard. New replies also show in notifications.

q: I’m not receiving notifications.
a: Check browser/site notification permissions and your profile notification settings.

q: Is my data secure?
a: We use HTTPS and follow best practices for authentication and data handling.

q: How do I delete my account?
a: Use Account Settings if available or contact support. Data removal follows our policy.

q: What is the Third Party role?
a: Vendors handling specialized orders (e.g., logistics, printing, rentals) with their own dashboard.

q: How do I track third-party orders?
a: Use the Third Party dashboard’s Orders section for status and details.

q: I’m an admin. Where is the control panel?
a: Go to /admin or use the Admin panel links if your account has the Admin role.

q: How do I manage FAQs or event categories?
a: Use the Admin dashboard sections for FAQs and event categories/types.

q: The site can’t reach the server. What should I do?
a: Ensure your internet is stable. If issues persist, try again later or contact support with the time and action attempted.

q: I get an ‘Unauthorized’ page.
a: Your session may have expired or your role lacks access. Log in again or switch to an account with the required role.

q: What payment methods are accepted?
a: Payment methods depend on provider and region. See the Payments section at checkout for available options.

q: How long is a quote valid?
a: Quote validity is set by each provider. Check the quote details for the expiration date/time.

q: What are provider booking limits?
a: Providers can set max concurrent bookings and lead-time windows. Availability depends on those settings.

q: How do service providers onboard?
a: Register as a Service Provider, complete business details, upload documentation if required, and create service listings.

q: Where can I find the cancellation policy?
a: On the provider profile and during checkout; it’s also visible on your booking page.

q: Can I get invoices for my payments?
a: Yes. Invoices are available under the booking’s Payments section after each payment.

q: Do you support multiple currencies?
a: Currency support depends on regional settings. The checkout page shows the currency used for your booking.

q: How do I contact support?
a: Open Profile > Support or use the Help link in the footer. Include your booking or account ID if applicable.

q: Is there a limit on review image uploads?
a: Yes, limits may apply to file size and count. If an upload fails, reduce file size or the number of images.

q: What’s the difference between a venue and a vendor?
a: A venue is the event location; vendors (service providers) offer services like décor, catering, photography, etc.

q: Hello
a: Hi there! How can I help with your event today?

q: Thanks
a: You’re welcome! Anything else I can help with?

q: Bye
a: Goodbye! Have a great day.

q: Where is the home page?
a: Go to the root URL ‘/’. From there you can browse Events, Services, and Providers.

q: How do I view event details?
a: Open Events and click an event. The details page shows description, galleries, reviews, and related services.

q: What is the Events page for?
a: It lists event categories and popular event types so you can explore ideas and providers for each category.

q: How do I start creating an event?
a: Go to Create Event. You can start with basics and add services later.

q: Where do I pick services for my event?
a: After creating your event, go to Create Event > Services to select categories and providers.

q: What is the overview step in create event?
a: The overview shows a summary of your selected categories and preferences before you confirm your plan.

q: How do I browse providers by category?
a: Use the Providers listing for a specific category from Services or the Events page and apply filters like location and budget.

q: How do I open a provider profile?
a: Click a provider card to see their profile with services, pricing, reviews, FAQs, and policies.

q: Where is the gallery?
a: Open the Gallery page to see curated images and event showcases for inspiration.

q: How do I access the customer dashboard?
a: Navigate to /customer/dashboard after logging in as a Customer.

q: How do I access the service provider dashboard?
a: Navigate to /service-provider after logging in as a Service Provider.

q: How do I access the third-party dashboard?
a: Navigate to /thirdparty after logging in with a Third Party account.

q: How do I access the admin panel?
a: Use /admin for the panel. If you need to log in, go to /adminlogin first.

q: Where is the admin login page?
a: Go to /adminlogin to sign in as an Admin.

q: Why do I see ‘Unauthorized’?
a: Your role doesn’t meet the page’s requirement or your session expired. Log in again with the correct role.

q: Why was I logged out automatically?
a: Sessions expire for security. Log back in to continue.

q: Can I use the site without an account?
a: Yes, you can browse events, providers, and galleries. You’ll need an account to book or message providers.

q: How do I switch roles?
a: Roles are tied to your account. Log out and sign in with an account that has the desired role, or contact support.

q: How do I search for services?
a: Use the Services section or the search bar to find providers by name, category, or keywords.

q: How can I compare providers?
a: Open provider profiles and compare pricing, inclusions, portfolio images, and reviews.

q: How do I request a quote?
a: Click ‘Request Quote’ on a provider profile and share your event date, location, and requirements.

q: What information helps get accurate quotes?
a: Provide your event date, venue/location, expected guests, budget range, and any style/themes you prefer.

q: How do I confirm a booking?
a: Accept an approved quote and follow the payment instructions on the booking page.

q: Where can I see my booking status?
a: Open the booking page or the dashboard’s bookings list to review current status and next steps.

q: How do I message a provider after booking?
a: Open the booking or the provider’s profile and use the Messages feature to continue the conversation.

q: Why is my provider not replying?
a: Providers may be busy. Give them time or send a polite follow-up. If urgent, consider messaging another provider.

q: Can I add multiple providers to one event?
a: Yes. You can book multiple providers (e.g., décor, photography, catering) for a single event plan.

q: How do I change my event date?
a: Request a date change from the booking page or message the provider to confirm availability.

q: Where can I see provider policies?
a: On each provider profile and during checkout. Policies include cancellation, rescheduling, and payment terms.

q: How do I add a review?
a: After your event, open the completed booking and click ‘Leave a review’. Rate and add comments; photos are optional.

q: What rating scale do you use?
a: Ratings are on a 1 to 5 star scale. You can include a short text review and optional photos.

q: Can I edit my review?
a: Reviews can be edited within a limited time window. If you need help, contact support with your booking ID.

q: Where do I upload event inspiration images?
a: You can add images in messages to providers or attach them when requesting quotes if supported by the provider.

q: How do I see provider availability?
a: Ask for a quote with your date or message the provider directly to check availability for your event day.

q: Do you support installment payments?
a: Installments depend on each provider. Review payment terms on the provider profile or the checkout page.

q: Can I get a pro-forma invoice?
a: Some providers offer pro-forma invoices with quotes. Ask the provider when requesting a quote.

q: What happens after I cancel?
a: You’ll see the booking marked as canceled. Any refund depends on the provider’s cancellation policy.

q: Can I transfer a booking to another date or person?
a: Transfers depend on provider policy and availability. Contact the provider via the booking page.

q: How do I report a provider issue?
a: Use the booking page or Profile > Support with your booking ID and a brief description of the issue.

q: How do I become a service provider?
a: Register as a Service Provider, complete your profile, add services and pricing, and publish your listings.

q: What should providers include in listings?
a: Clear descriptions, inclusions, pricing ranges, portfolio images, FAQs, and policies to set expectations.

q: How do providers manage messages?
a: Use the Messages section in the Service Provider dashboard to view and reply to client inquiries.

q: How do providers get paid?
a: Payments are handled through the booking’s Payments section. Payout schedules depend on provider settings and policies.

q: Where can third-party vendors see orders?
a: In the Third Party dashboard under Orders. You can view status, details, and update progress.

q: How do I update an order’s status (Third Party)?
a: Open the order in the Third Party dashboard and set the current status with any notes if required.

q: What is the Admin Event Management section?
a: It’s for admins to manage event categories, metadata, and related content displayed to users.

q: How do Admins manage FAQs?
a: Use the Admin FAQs section to add, edit, or archive frequently asked questions shown across the app.

q: Where do Admins manage offers and promotions?
a: In the Admin dashboard’s Offers section, you can create and schedule promotional items.

q: How do I enable notifications in my browser?
a: Allow notifications for this site in your browser settings, then check your profile notification preferences.

q: Why don’t images load?
a: Check your internet connection and try again. If the issue persists, clear cache or contact support with the page URL.

q: Does Google Sign-In create a new account?
a: If your email isn’t registered, a new account is created. Otherwise, Google Sign-In connects to your existing account.

q: Can I change my registered email?
a: Email updates may require verification. Open Profile settings; if unavailable, contact support.

q: Do you support multiple events per account?
a: Yes. You can create and manage multiple events from your dashboard.

q: Can I duplicate a past event?
a: Yes, if the feature is available. Check your event list for a ‘Duplicate’ option or ask support to assist.

q: How do I set a budget range?
a: Use filters when browsing providers or include your budget in the quote request for tailored proposals.

q: Where can I see FAQs for a specific event type?
a: Open the event details page; FAQs are shown alongside reviews and key details if available.

q: Where can I see provider FAQs?
a: Provider profiles often include a FAQs section that addresses services, timelines, and policies.

q: How do I upload required documents (providers)?
a: Use your provider profile or onboarding steps to upload documents like licenses or IDs if requested.

q: How do I update my business availability (providers)?
a: Update your availability and booking limits in your provider settings or calendar if supported.

q: Can providers set minimum lead time?
a: Yes. Providers can set minimum lead-time and booking window days in their settings to manage requests.

q: I see a blank page after login.
a: Refresh the page or try logging out and in again. If it continues, contact support with time and browser details.

q: How do I change my password?
a: Use Profile settings or the Reset Password option if you’re logged out.

q: Does the platform support custom themes for events?
a: Yes. Many providers support custom themes. Mention your theme in quotes or messages to get tailored proposals.

q: Can I attach files in messages?
a: Attachment support may vary. If you can’t attach files, send links or reduce file size and try again.

q: Can I hide my profile information from providers?
a: Only necessary contact details are shared for bookings. Review the privacy policy for specifics.

q: Where do I see my invoices and receipts?
a: Open each booking’s Payments section to download invoices and receipts for completed transactions.

q: How do I contact support urgently?
a: Use Profile > Support and mark the request as urgent with your booking ID and a brief summary.

q: Can I book a provider outside my city?
a: Yes, many providers travel. Travel fees or availability may vary—confirm in the quote request.

q: What if my event date changes?
a: Request a reschedule. If the provider isn’t available, you can cancel based on their policy and rebook another provider.

q: Do you store my payment details?
a: Payment processing follows security standards. Refer to the payment provider’s policy for how details are stored.

q: Are there platform service fees?
a: Fees may apply depending on region and payment method. The checkout shows any applicable fees before you confirm.

q: Can I chat with support in-app?
a: If live chat is enabled, use the chat widget. Otherwise, use Profile > Support or email support.

q: What browsers are supported?
a: Recent versions of Chrome, Edge, Firefox, and Safari are supported. Update your browser if you encounter issues.

q: How do I clear cache to fix UI issues?
a: Use your browser’s clear cache option, then reload the app. Try an incognito window to rule out extensions.
